alert.note: Alert for Carroll (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 31 at 9:03PM CDT until June 03 at 1:41AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Wakenda Creek at Carrollton affecting Carroll County. This product along with additional weather and stream information is available at www.weather.gov/kc/. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wakenda Creek at Carrollton. * WHEN...Until early Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding of low-lying undeveloped areas along the creek begins. At 19.1 feet, Water reaches the bottom of the South Main Street bridge over Wakenda Creek. At 19.8 feet, South Main Street along with Stonewall Street and Wabash Road on the south side of Carrollton are overtopped by flood waters. Flood waters also threaten businesses in low-lying areas near the creek. At 20.7 feet, Wakenda Creek begins to flood the first floors of businesses along South Main Street in Carrollton. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 18.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Obs Forecasts Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri 1am 1am 1am Wakenda Creek Carrollton 16.0 14.4 Tue 8pm 16.5 16.4 8.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
